body.p: A Kentucky farmer, attorney, and politician. Educated at private schools and attended from the University of Virginia. Studied law and admitted to the bar in 1837. Practiced law in New Castle, Kentucky. Member of the Whig Party and Democratic Party. Married to Matlida Cathering Taylor Mallory. Father of Elizabeth Willett Mallory, Robert Mallory, Jr., Matilda “Mattie” C. Mallory, and Fannie Mallory. Served the Fifth and Seventh Congressional District of Kentucky as a member of the United States House of Representative from 1859 to 1865. Served as a delegate to the 1866 Union National Convention at Philadelphia.
